Callosobruchus maculatus (Fabricius, 1775) (Coleoptera: Chrysomelidae), the main cowpea insect pest
1 , shows cosmopolitan habit, is found on stored legumes and its biology and ecology have been studied
2 . Seed destruction by this insect is often so great that the grains become unfit for human consumption and nonviable for replanting or commercialization
2 after a few months of storage
3 . Adequate storage of agricultural products aims to reduce losses due to insect damage using mainly chemical control with pyrethroids, organophosphates or fumigants such as phosphine (with aluminum phosphide being its precursor)
4 . Overuse of synthetic insecticides causes risks, toxicity to human health and environmental contamination
5 . Insecticides of plant origin have been investigated to manage insects in stored grains

9 were the first preservatives used by man, originally in their natural state and later on, as oils obtained through distillation in water
